# Install `R`

Letâ€™s install the newest version of __R__. This data software is contributed to and maintained by people all around the world. It lets you perform data analysis like you're writing a recipe for chocolate chip cookies. Once you've written your favorite recipe you can use it over and over again and share it with your collaborators. 


__Install R__  

1. Open your web browser and navigate to R's download page -> [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org).
1. Choose your operating system from the top. Or use the shortcuts below.
    - __WINDOWS__ go here: [Windows](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/)
    - __MAC__ go here: [Mac](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/)
        - Scroll down and download the highest numbered file (ex. __R-3.5.0.pkg__)
    - __LINUX__ go here: [Linux](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/linux/)
1. Open the file and install with the default options.


<br>

# Install `RStudio` 

Now let's install the newest version of __RStudio__. This is the handy user interface we use to write R scripts and keep our projects organized. It isn't required to use R, but it makes things easier.


__Install RStudio__  


1. Open your web browser and navigate to [www.rstudio.com](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).
1. Choose your operating system and download the newest version.
1. Open the file and install with the default options.
1. You are officially ready.

<br>

<div class="toggle"><button class = "btn_code_blue">_Instructions for MPCA staff_</button>
<br>

1. Open the Start menu. \ \*_Click the Window's logo on the bottom left of the screen._
1. Search for _Software Center_
1. Select ` R Studio-1.1.383 - Install `
1. Click the blue _INSTALL_ button down in the lower right.
1. A secret window will open behind the _Software Center_. Find it by minimizing the _Software Center_.
1. In the installation window, click _Next_.
1. Install RStudio to the default folder `C:\Program Files `
</div>
